keyMoments.title: Oars Begins Hunting the Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: Oars receives explicit orders from Moria to capture and destroy every Straw Hat Pirate, beginning his active hunt for the crew.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the beginning of Oars' role as the primary physical antagonist hunting the crew throughout Thriller Bark.

keyMoments.title: Oars Uses Gomu Gomu no Kane
keyMoments.description: Oars demonstrates that he can use Luffy's fighting techniques, attempting Gomu Gomu no Kane despite lacking rubber abilities.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals that Oars has access to all of Luffy's combat knowledge and fighting instincts through the implanted shadow.

keyMoments.title: Oars Challenges the Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: Oars roars out a challenge for all the Straw Hat Pirates to face him in battle.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the major crew battle that will occur in subsequent episodes.
keyMoments.quote: Come out, Straw Hat crew! Fight me!

abilities.description: Oars attempts to use Luffy's Gum-Gum Bell technique, though he cannot actually stretch.

reveals.information: Can use Luffy's combat techniques despite lacking rubber body

keyMoments.title: Cindry's Humanity Resurfaces
keyMoments.description: Cindry refuses to obey Hogback's command to save him and smiles warmly at Chopper, revealing her original personality breaking through zombie programming.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates that traces of humanity remain even in zombies, providing emotional closure to Cindry's tragic story.

relationships.description: Cindry was resurrected as a zombie by Hogback, who was obsessed with her. In this episode, her humanity resurfaces and she refuses to save him.

evolutionMoments.description: Cindry's original personality breaks through and she refuses to save Hogback when he's in danger.

reveals.information: Original personality and humanity still exist beneath zombie programming

keyMoments.title: Pierna Fleur Debuts
keyMoments.description: Robin debuts her Pierna Fleur (Leg Flower) technique, sprouting multiple legs from the ground.
keyMoments.significance: Expands Robin's Devil Fruit abilities to include leg sprouting, not just arms.

keyMoments.title: Robi-Cho Suplex Attempted
keyMoments.description: Robin and Chopper attempt their first combination technique, though it's interrupted by Oars.
keyMoments.significance: First named combination technique between Robin and Chopper.

abilities.description: Robin sprouts multiple legs from the ground to create platforms or attack.
Combination technique with Chopper where Robin uses Pierna Fleur to elevate Chopper for a high-impact suplex attack.

reveals.information: Can sprout legs using Hana Hana no Mi, not just arms

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Receives Cindry's Smile
keyMoments.description: Chopper witnesses Cindry's humanity resurface as she smiles at him warmly, showing her original personality.
keyMoments.significance: Provides emotional closure to the Cindry subplot and demonstrates Chopper's impact on others.

keyMoments.title: Robi-Cho Suplex Attempted
keyMoments.description: Chopper and Robin attempt their first combination technique, though interrupted before completion.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Chopper's growing tactical coordination with crew members.

abilities.description: Combination technique with Robin where Chopper performs a suplex from great height using Robin's leg platforms.

relationships.description: Chopper showed compassion for Cindry as a zombie, and she responded with her humanity in this episode.

evolutionMoments.description: Cindry's smile at Chopper shows mutual recognition and her humanity breaking through.

keyMoments.title: Hogback Crushed by Oars
keyMoments.description: Hogback is trampled and crushed by Oars while Cindry refuses to save him.
keyMoments.significance: Delivers poetic justice to Hogback for his twisted experiments with the dead.
